data.architecture: The project is structured as a CLI tool that automates the setup of a parallel development workflow. It uses Node.js and several npm packages to provide a command-line interface, installation logic, environment validation, and configuration setup. The project is distributed as an NPX package.

agents.agentRole: Responsible for the package.json and distribution

data.parallelizationStrategy: Each agent is responsible for a distinct functional domain and owns all the files related to that domain. This allows all agents to work simultaneously without any dependencies on each other. The agents do not modify any shared files, ensuring there are no file conflicts.
data.reasoning: The decomposition is based on the distinct functional domains of the project: CLI, installation, validation, configuration, and distribution. Each of these domains can be developed independently, allowing for maximum parallelization. The agents do not have any dependencies on each other, and each agent owns all the files in their domain, ensuring there are no file conflicts.
